intro: Urachne fusca, commonly known as the dark urachne, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and a distinctive yellow center. Urachne fusca is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
